name: Guru Nanak
role: Spiritual teacher and founder of Sikhism
what_did:
Guru Nanak traveled widely to spread his message of one God, equality, and kindness.
He taught that all people — no matter their caste, religion, or background — are equal.
He started the Sikh faith, which focuses on service, honesty, and devotion.
why_matters:
Guru Nanak’s teachings helped form a new religion: Sikhism.
He encouraged peace between religions and stood up against unfair treatment.
His ideas are still followed by millions of Sikhs around the world.
